entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Welcome to a new week with a couple of fun tasks "Replace Words" and "Word Search". If you are new to the weekly challenge then why not join us and have fun every week. For more information, please read the FAQ.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge - 299

entries.author: mohammad_anwar
entries.text: Enjoy a quick recap of last week's contributions by Team PWC dealing with the "Maximal Square" and "Right Interval" tasks in Perl and Raku. You will find plenty of solutions to keep you busy.
entries.title: RECAP - The Weekly Challenge - 298

entries.author: arne_sommer
entries.text: If you code like this in any language then debugging becomes a cake walk. Well done and thanks for sharing.
entries.title: Maximal Right

entries.author: jorg_sommrey
entries.text: Being a student of Math, I simply love the pure mathematical approach. I miss these symbols in my programming world. Great work.
entries.title: The Right Square

entries.author: luca_ferrari
entries.text: Pl/Perl implementation is worth checking, incredible. It reminded me when I used to do PL/SQL as in Oracle 9 days. Highly recommended.
entries.title: arrays and matrixes

entries.author: luis_mochan
entries.text: Another great demo of PDL. It is becoming very common these days. Keep sharing knowledge with us.
entries.title: Perl Weekly Challenge 298

entries.author: matthias_muth
entries.text: Well narrated and self documented solution. Going through the ups and downs is not to be missed. I enjoyed the journey, well done.
entries.title: Maximally Indexed Indices

entries.author: peter_campbell_smith
entries.text: Nested loops using label to move around is fun to watch. Thanks for sharing knowledge with us every week.
entries.title: Turn right at the big square

entries.author: robbie_hatley
entries.text: Simple and easy approach without any gimmicks. Great work, keep it up.
entries.title: The Weekly Challenge #298

entries.author: roger_bell_west
entries.text: My favourite Postscript solution is discussed in the post again. It is fascinating to be honest. Highly recommended.
entries.title: Whatever You Do, Be Maximally Right

entries.author: simon_green
entries.text: Dealing with two dimension list in Python is so fun to watch. Anyone looking to get exposure in Python this is your friend.
entries.title: Maximizing the interval

chapters.header: The Weekly Challenge by Mohammad Sajid Anwar will help you step out of your comfort-zone. You can even win prize money of $50 by participating in the weekly challenge. We pick one champion at the end of the month from among all of the contributors during the month, thanks to the sponsor Lance Wicks.
chapters.title: The Weekly Challenge

header: If you follow Perl release or want to watch what is involved. Please do note this date, 20th Dec, when it is going to be live stream the release of v5.41.7 on Twitch.
For all regulars to Perl and Raku Conference, you can now plan your visit as discussed in the blog post. I would highly recommend you take a closer look.
Advent Calendar is busy spreading fun and knowledge. You should checkout these: Perl Advent Calendar 2024 and The Weekly Challenge Advent Calendar 2024.
Enjoy the festive season and look after your health, specialky mental.
subject: Perl v5.41.7
